title: [BUG]  'env_activate_cmd' referenced before assignment when using mlflow models build-docker --env-manager=local

labels.name: area/build
labels.description: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow

body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.

### MLflow version

1.26.1

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Archlinux
- **Python version**: 3.9.9




### Describe the problem

I have a very tiny mlflow pyfunc model which I can build into a docker using
```bash
mlflow models build-docker --model-uri 'models:/predict_service/latest' --enable-mlserver --name predict_service
```
When using `--env-manager=local`, I get a Python error saying:

```bash
  2022/06/10 10:00:47 INFO mlflow.models.container: creating and activating custom environment
  Traceback (most recent call last):
    File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
    File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py", line 124, in _install_pyfunc_deps
      activate_cmd = [env_activate_cmd] if has_env else []
  UnboundLocalError: local variable 'env_activate_cmd' referenced before assignment
```
Which refers to https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/models/container/__init__.py#L124 where indeed the variable is reference before assignment.


### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

mlflow models build-docker --model-uri 'models:/predict_service/latest' --enable-mlserver --name predict_service --env-manager=local

### Other info / logs

_No response_

- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry

### What language(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients

### What integration(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations

- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
